enabled.description:
Turn on Pod replicas number autoscaling instead of setting a constant value. your
cluster must support [ Horizontal Pod Autoscaling ](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/).
enabled.title: enabled

maxReplicas.description: Max number of Pods autoscaler can deploy.
maxReplicas.title: maxReplicas

minReplicas.description: Min number of Pods autoscaler can deploy.
minReplicas.title: minReplicas

targetCPUUtilizationPercentage.description: Pod scale up critieria based on CPU usage.
targetCPUUtilizationPercentage.title: targetCPUUtilizationPercentage

targetMemoryUtilizationPercentage.description: Pod scale up critieria based on Memory usage.
targetMemoryUtilizationPercentage.title: targetMemoryUtilizationPercentage

database.description:
Secret that contains database connection details. It has to be present in the
same namespace as the Chart is deployed to. Has to have `endpoint`, `username`
and `password` keys. May contain `port` key.

connectionSecretName.description:
Secret that contains database connection details. It has to be present in the
same namespace as the Chart is deployed to. Has to have `endpoint`, `username`
and `password` keys. May contain `port` key.
connectionSecretName.title: connectionSecretName

name.description: Name of a logical database to use
name.title: name

database.title: database

fullnameOverride.description: Override the default name generated for this specific chart Release.
fullnameOverride.title: fullnameOverride

ginMode.description: Configure run mode of the gin web framework; can be 'debug' or 'production'
ginMode.title: ginMode

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

registry.description: Set the domain of your container images registry.
registry.title: registry

repository.description: Set the name of the repository within the registry.
repository.title: repository

tag.description: Image tag to use, defaults to .Chart.AppVersion
tag.title: tag

imagePullSecrets.description: Configure login secrets for the container images registry.
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

inMemoryStore.description:
When set to "true", the app doesn't use any database at all and stores all the
data in memory only.
inMemoryStore.title: inMemoryStore

annotations.description:
Optional annotations for the Ingress definition. If your cluster has "CertManager"
operator running, you can use "cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer"
annotation to [automatically generate a certificate for it](https://cert-manager.io/docs/usage/).
annotations.title: annotations

className.description:
Ingress controller implementations use this field to know whether they should be
serving this Ingress resource, by a transitive connection.
className.title: className

enabled.description:
Should the Service be accessible through an Ingress. This needs an Ingress controller
to be configured already on your cluster.
enabled.title: enabled

host.description: HTTP host that you want to use for your service.
host.title: host

tls.description:
Optional TLS certificate configuration. You can use it with "CertManager" or
provide your own certificate.
tls.title: tls

serviceMonitor.description:
If your cluster supports prometheus-operator configuration of metrics data,
enable this to have metrics from your application automatically ingested
by prometheus.

extraLabels.description: Optional extra labels to put on the serviceMonitor
extraLabels.title: extraLabels

serviceMonitor.title: serviceMonitor

nameOverride.description: Override the default name generated for the chart objects.
nameOverride.title: nameOverride

nodeSelector.description: Optional node delector to limit the nodes where pods of the chart can be deployed.
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

pdb.description:
Should the chart deploy a [PodDisruptionBudget](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/configure-pdb/)
to limit disruptions based on administrative tasks.
pdb.title: pdb

podAnnotations.description: Set additional annotations for the pods created.
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

podListenPort.description: Configure the TCP port on which your pods will listen for connections.
podListenPort.title: podListenPort

redisConnectionSecretName.description:
Secret that contains redis connection details. It has to be present in the
same namespace as the Chart is deployed to. Has to have `host`, `username`
and `password` keys. May contain `port` key.
redisConnectionSecretName.title: redisConnectionSecretName

replicaCount.description: Number of Pod replicas to deploy. Used only if 'autoscaling.enabled' is 'false'.
replicaCount.title: replicaCount

annotations.description:
Optional annotations for the Service definition. If your cluster has "ExternalDNS"
operator running, you can use "external-dns.alpha.kubernetes.io/hostname"
annotation to [automatically register DNS name for your service](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/external-dns).
annotations.title: annotations

port.description: TCP port that the service will be exposed on.

The name of the service account to use.
